caption: The service here is polite, informative, professional, and weirdly fast. The food is worthy of being categorized with some of the best in Central West End. The patio is great; has a lot of shade for the hot summer days.
The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is the place is small!! The drinks were good and I don’t think I’ve ever had French fries so good!!
Parking nearby is not likely to happen so be prepared to walk a block or more once you find a place to park.  Wait staff was fantastic and prompt.  Drinks I had were perfect!
We sat at the bar. Huge variety of interesting cocktails. Bacon fat cornbread is amazing.

Dim lighting, good (but slightly overpriced) food, good drinks, and friendly staff. Seating feels a tiny bit snug, but it's not awful, and matches up with other spots in the Central West End (ex: Scarlett's). I'll be going back for sure.
Great cocktails and great service!
It was amazing

This place is a hidden gem! Taste is the key to your senses, the food is amazing (best mushrooms we’ve had, down to the pickled shaved vegetables under it, sooo good!) the bartenders are more like mixologists but there is nothing uptight about this place. It is so comfortable and inviting! Even the bathrooms smell amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed it!

The only reason this place is getting 2 stars from me is because I like their food. Cocktails are good, but very, very small. The reason for my 2-star review is Unfriendliness of this place! I have been a customer for a past year, maybe a little less, and have yet to run into a friendly staff member! Last time I visited this place was just terrible customer service on part of the hostess who behaves like she's literally a Hollywood star plastic surgeon: I have never seen in my life hostess so full of herself. I walked in, and wanted to sit at a bar with my husband and a friend, and there WAS enough room at a bar for 5 people, but she said "We don't have enough space for all of you", and I said: "Well, I don't mind standing if you're missing a chair", to which she replied: "Per my manager's policy I am not allowed to let you do that." I said OK, and she just stood there looking down at me. All three of us looked at each other confused as to what was going on, and we just walked out. SHE REFUSED to service us, although we were more then appropriately dressed, and not even close to being drunk because we had not had a single drink prior to coming here. Also, let me mention that it was 9:30pm, so not an extremely busy time. She was never very pleasant, whenever me and my husband were there, and tends to brush me off every time I'm there, but this last time was just too much. I can't believe that a place like this would allow something like that to happen!!! I have taken 15 minutes of my time to contact the bar via the contact page, but it has been 4 days, and I still haven't gotten any reply. Ridiculous.
Unique little place with great cocktails.
A bit pricy for cocktails, but overall my experience was good. The ambiance is cozy and nice for an intimate night out.
Wonderful place.  Fun! Good staff and great food and drink.
great food, nice staff
I've only stopped in for the drinks, but they are fantastic. The bartenders really know what they're doing and it doesn't hurt they put in some flare when they're stirring up the cocktails.
Amazing food and ambiance!!! “Will” our bartender was wonderful! Definitely will be back!!!

I wanted apps for dinner and was craving a cheese plate and charcuterie board, and taste gave me exactly what I needed. The cheese plate came with three types of cheeses, a blue, a hard cheddar (I think), and a soft Brie. To accompany it, plenty of crispy thin slices of baguette and raisins. The charcuterie came with tiny pickles, grainy mustard, and three types of cured meats. Service was wonderful and very accommodating. Very chill environment.  Taste is a lovely place for a meal and a proper cocktail, which I would love to try next time!
Great atmosphere, staff was attentive to needs, the Brussels sprouts were excellent, and cocktails were hi ust right!
Overrated
Some of the most delicious food I've had in STL.
great drinks, great staff! one of my favorite places to have cocktail in the city!

I am disappointed. This was my favorite restaurant in St. Louis and a safe option to take my visiting guests as all the food and cocktails were amazing. Anything you ordered was good. After a much anticipated visit from our friends, we took them to Taste last night to show them what St. Louis is about. What a disappointment. All the food was terrible and the cocktail list even worse. Just a typical American fare with bigger portions and average tasting food you feel bad paying for. What changed, my friends? Go back to what you were doing before. You could tell it's changed. In the past we've needed to wait for a table. Yesterday (Friday night) it was empty. We left hungry to finish eating elsewhere, since food wasn't very good, so we had to wander around CWE at 10pm trying to find somewhere. Very disappointing. Don't think will go back.

This is the best place around here. I'm a big fan of the Brussels sprouts and fries. This place is always crowdy and great ! The chef does a great job of making sure every dish is a hit. Highly recommended.
Amazing drinks. Get the fries!

They have a small menu, with some pretty delicious options. I'm a big fan of the Brussels sprouts and fries. I hope in the future, they continue to expand their menu offerings! The chef does a great job of making sure every dish is a hit. Fun side note - the interior is gorgeous, but one of the coolest things inside is the bathroom
Tried the steak tartare and sazerac. Excellent food, atmosphere, and service

The photo is of the plate that formerly presented the coconut ice cream topped brownie. It was fabulous. The first TASTE of the warm brownie was amazing. The almond magic on the ice cream was equally amazing. The phot was an afterthought (you probably figured that out - too busy tasting). Taste has one of the most interesting and broad cocktail menus I’ve seen. The cocktails are very good. The small plates we tried were also good. The salmon tacos were very very good. In the down side is the noise level and the low light that made it hard for me to read the menu. I almost used my phone as a flashlight.
Cocktails are always fire and the exec chef is quite a visionary. Big Recommendation
Great cocktails!
Cute little hideaway with some interesting drinks and very pleasant staff. AC has a tuff time keeping up but we still enjoyed the our time and the decor.
Great service and food and drinks.

My wife and I stopped in for a drink before dinner at Brasserie next door.   Our  bartender was super friendly and very helpful recommending a cocktail for my wife.   I was very impressed with the care and precision he used for every drink I saw him make.  Ours were both phenomenal.  Can't recommend highly enough.
Sometimes the service brain-farts on an order but no reason to take away stars. One of the best.
Excellent flavor combinations and superb service!

Simply one of the best cocktail forward establishments I’ve been to. The tapas style  food selection is on par with the quality of drinks.  Honestly one of the best old-fashioned cocktails I’ve ever had. In a one-off experience, I chose to send a couple of drinks back, but they made it right in the end. 9/10 times, this place is excellent.  I no longer live in STL, and can only sit and pine, wishing my town had a cocktail venue like Taste.  Highly recommend.

Taste was such a rich experience to have. The small plates were definitely smaller than expected, but the flavors were perfect. The brown butter biscuits were delicious and the  gnocci was so savory. The bartender (named Nick) made several unique cocktails for my friends and I and we were all impressed by his ability to craft drinks. Very cool place to visit.
Nick was a fantastic bartender. He was personable, friendly, knowledgeable, and mixed terrific cocktails. Highly highly recommend!
Neat place to grab a drink! Romantic but also casual
Drinks were superb, food was bland.
My food was delicious,great drink and great Customer service.

Our party had 3 people, and we arrived early on a Thursday evening, so there was no wait for a table. The cocktail menu was interesting and extensive, with both classic and custom drinks. The food was all very good. We had a variety of snacks and small plates, so I can't rate the large plate items.  Two snack items stood out as outstanding: the bacon fat carrots and the tempura mushrooms.  Two small plate items also stood out: the gnocchi and the brussels sprouts. The service was excellent. All in all, a very positive experience.
Great menu of drinks that push the envelope, but are still enjoyable. Sides are hit/miss.

Great establishment, very friendly staff. I would say you would go here more for their wide variety of cocktails (I mean a lot!) and think of the small plates, and few main courses as a bonus. Food was great!  Place is on the smaller side, I suggest using the No Wait app to get in line or set reservation for parties of 6+. Has a bar, not a lot of room to wait for a table. They have communal seating as well as about 8ish tables that they can pull a part or push together.
Great food, good vibes

Craft cocktails in the best way with the best atmosphere.  This is my top pick for drinks in St. Louis.  The menu is small, but the Pork Burger has been there for as long as I can remember and is a definite must to try.  There are enough classics on this menu to try new items for a year, so I keep coming back.
Mmm the taste, is tasty. Music great, the playlist didnt skip a beat. Atomosphere exquisite. High grade ambience. And gosh dern, I feel like I'm at home! A+++ service. I am PLEE-ASED.

Extraordinary drink menu! We tried several of the "homemade" cocktails & loved each and every one. The snack plates are shareable although could of had a bit more flavor to them. Customer service was excellent, hell we stayed past closing hours enjoying the drinks! Love the bathrooms(dont get to say that to many times at restaurants)
Delicious, welcoming and romantic
Best cocktails in St. Louis. Very limited seating, but worth the wait.
Awesome food and great drinks.
Service is amazing, drinks are great. I had the Brussel sprouts and they were killer. Highly recommend this place.

My colleagues loved the drinks here, and the options are endless. With that said my visit wasn't incredibly just because there are so few small plates options here. This isn't a typical tapas restaurant for food but. For exmple, don't bring any vegetarians or anyone with a dietary restriction because you have literally 3 entree choices. But for food the oysters and gnochi are amazing. Even the brussel sprouts quicky became one of my favorites.
The service and food were both OUTSTANDING
Cocktails made the way they were intended.   Albeit at a steep price.  Excellence seldom comes cheap.
Good place to get a drink and a few small plates to share.

Ok this place May be bad timing because I'm pregnant. The brussel sprouts and bacon made me want to vomit. The restroom was beautiful and it smelled amazing. Staff was nice too and professional. I give them a B for the ambience. My current pregnant self gives the food a C-
Really really good food!
Great food and drinks
One of the best cocktail bars in St Louis. Their small plates are very good too, me and my partner can easily share 2-3 of those and call it dinner. Very cozy and romantic setting.
Cozy setting, delicious small plates, and fearsome cocktails!
Friendly, attentive wait staff. Great atmosphere.
Been here dozens of times. One of, if not THE, top spot for cocktails in the STL
We had several dishes and they were all excellent and so was the service. I'm excited to return.

Awesome little tavern, with excellent service. I took a date here for our first really romantic date, and it certainly exceeded our expectations. The food was phenomenal, the drink selection was expansive, and the waitress was very accommodating. Would definitely come here again.

This place is incredible in every way possible! The atmosphere is very classy, with low lighting and candles all throughout; it's great for a date or for celebrating an occasion with a small group. It's a cocktail bar, but the food is beyond excellent. They have a pretty short menu of mostly small plates, all of which I've tried. The dishes are unique and elevated with lots of complex flavors. Everything is skillfully prepared and plated beautifully; not a single dish is short of great. It's no surprise that the drink menu is very extensive. I stuck to traditional cocktails, which they do well, but there's a long list of their own creations as well. Servers are very kind and knowledgeable. Overall, Taste is one of the better places I've dined in St. Louis!
Sundays and Mondays: $7 classic cocktails!
Pricey but quaint.

A must visit. Terrific small plate selection, fabulous and accommodating staff, and the cocktails... a fantastic selection, but if you can't find something on the extensive menu, Taste will handcraft something special just for you!! Also, we went with three tween to teen girls in tow, and our wonderful server quizzed them on their likes/dislikes and then brought them each individually handcrafted mock-tails! The patio is charming, and the inside is just as cute.
We came in during a pouring rain and they offered towels to help us dry off.  Great service and a wonderful place.
Great staff!
Exactly what I needed.   Even the fries were fantastic.
Host was really nice to me until he found out I was a postmate. That’s annoying.

This place was really really good. It’s a place intended for drinks more than food, food wise they have only a few options. We got the seafood salad, gnocchi, mussels. Everything was super good. But I have to pause and make a special mention to the seafood salad, was so F#$&* good!! I could have ordered 3 of those. For drinks I have to say that, the daiquiri (tiki special) was really good... We would totally come back for more drinks, the cocktail menu is quite extensive.
Stopped in for a quick bite and a drink - great place. Great atmosphere, food was spot on and drinks were great.
The small plates  are a bit pricey so i wouldn't cone for a full meal but the drinks are handcrafted and there isn't a place in at Louis that crafts a cocktail quite as tasty!
This is my favorite bar ever. I tend to only like the best places, and this is one of them. Anybody will love this place. Especially the happy hour on Sunday and Monday.
Great food and crafted cocktails! The all day happy hours on Sunday and Monday are great!!
Great cocktails and amazing staff. Very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and helping you find something you like. The prices are also much lower than I expected.
Amazing, vintage cocktails and super knowledgeable staff

This place hooked us! Went here with my brothers for a bachelor's dinner, and they delivered!  Food: the devils in the detail here.... Quality food. Every bite was a symphony to the taste buds! From the Brussel Sprouts, to the brownie, everything we ordered had an amazing subtle flavor hiding behind the main initial taste. The bruschetta was a little different.... A darkened, almost burnt taste in the outside crust, but with incredible flavor in the topping.  Service: Michael was a fantastic wait or, very knowledgeable about every detail of the menu we asked about plus some. I couldn't decide on a drink, so he asked a few questions about what I was feeling like and then said, "I'll bring you something" - what he came back with was perfection! He even played a song we requested through the system!  There wasn't a drink or food choice I wouldn't go back for. (except maybe the octopus which just tasted like chicken. :p)  Definitely a place I'm coming back to...
Taste is the best. Best drinks, best wait staff, best French fries, best music to drink along to. It’s poetic.
Excellent small plates. Try the wings and meat/ cheese plates
Best Old Fashioned in STL!
Great cocktails, knowledgeable and helpful servers!
One of my favorite spots to sip some of the best cocktails in the STL.
Some of the best cocktails in the entire city.
A bit pricy
Employee was very knowledgeable about the cocktail menu. She asked us what we like and made suggestions based on that. Drinks were "tasty" and even the ice cubes were cool.
Very nice and cozy for a romantic fancy drink, but not recommend if you are looking for a large American dinner
Great cocktails and food. Great place for date night.

Hey Taste. Your host was horrible and has no concept of accommodation. She was even training a young woman and served as a poor example of a hostess. She over explained herself, was confusing, and overall unaware of how to retain a possible consumer. We explained that we were expecting five or six folks, and she explained that there was currently no space and didn't give us the option to chill at the bar.  There were enough seats to accommodate us, although the seats weren't contiguous...but we were prepared to make due. I urged her that we'd be okay at the bar, needed no hand holding, and would wait for seating to open up. The bartender was pretty great. I wanted a mezcal drink, but there was no specific cocktail on the menu...but he still made me a great citrus based drink that tasted great. I ordered a scallop crudo that was a disaster. The chef needs to seriously modify this dish. For starters, it should not be sitting in pools of sub-par butter. These perfectly prepared scallops were wasted in the presentation. The fries were great, as well as the (housemade?) garlic aioli. Our sixth person came and we saw that there was a four top and an adjacent two top available. They weren't reserved, so I was pretty excited to take a seat and order up half the menu. We were, although, blocked by the host with a flurry of excuses of why we couldn't sit at these seats. She was speaking in circles and after three minutes of near begging, I suggested that me move on to another establishment. I am pretty far from this in my life and current experiences, but I can safely say that our race played a huge part in the difficulty around being seated at Taste, which was a huge disappointment. I've served as a high end line cook, personal chef, front of the house employee at several establishments and although I do understand the stereotypes that commonly marginalize Black patrons, it's totally bogus and not okay. We were prepared to have a great time, and tip more than accordingly.
Always judge a place by its toilets... 5/5... Cosy lil establishment, great small plates and the cocktail mixologist is a master at her craft...

The best cocktails in town, the best fries in town, and the best vibe in town. The food menu does change so that's a plus if you are interested in keeping it fresh. The music is also great here. They keep fresh herbs on the bar and the mixologist are always great conversationalist.
Always tasty

Omg Taste. Beautiful, hand-crafted cocktails and luxurious small plates with a few well-made entrees and desserts. The menu changes frequently to take advantage of local produce and seasonal dishes. Love.
Amazing cocktails warm atmosphere
Amazing bartenders!!!
One of my favorite places.  The food and drinks are unique and sometimes unforgettable!
Great
It's kinda pricey. Food is decent. Cocktails are good but still overpriced.
Amazing! Service, Food! EVERYTHING! Mushrooms are to die for! Deviled eggs and cheese curds were phenomenal! Brownie dessert was perfect! Must go to place on the STL! Ask for BRANDON!
A favorite place to show out of Towners. I always find something new to try and it's always delicious.

Great cocktail bar with many drinks calling for our return. If you don't know what you like or dislike, this may give you decision-anxiety. The staff seem willing enough to help you through questions though so maybe it wouldnt be so bad for some. The drinks we ordered were a great blend of components I can't imagine the others to be bad unless you dislike a specific ingredient. We ordered small plates (Caesar salad and chicken wings) as well to go with the drinks. The wings are HOT so keep that in mind. Very delicious though. The Caesar is...a Caesar. Nice surprise to have the croutons actually be breaded chicken.
Great place for cocktails and small plates!
Ask for Brandon! He is awesome! Great drinks drinks, food, service, and menu! Ideal for date night!
Great drink menu. The food not so much.
Went here for happy hour. Drinks were great, and the fries were delicious.

If I could give that place 10 stars, I would! Always an exceptional drinks,  food and service! This place inspired my husband to have his own mixology bar! Our absolutely favorite spot! Highly recommend!!!🍹🍹🍹
Quaint cocktail bar. Bartenders were knowledgeable, and service was great. Happy hour is $7 classic cocktails and runs until 7
Great classic cocktails with good attention to detail.
Great small plates for after work.
Brunch was excellent. Sat on the outdoor patio.
Delightful food with a smooth, well run wait staff makes for a great dining experience!
Good food and drinks...but the bartender was very slow in making the drinks
Such an amazing place for food! Try the nudi!
Perfect place for a cocktail

Very romantic! Went here on a date and it was wonderful. The staff were all very intuitive and brought fresh bread to dip in our mussel sauce before we had polished off the previous round so it would be hot and delicious.. how thoughtful! Also ordered the small plate flat iron steak that came with a perfect amount of sear on the edge! We ordered a round of drinks and then switched to their bowl-sized beverage option which was a fun novelty to try :) Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!
Food is fantastic
Incredible food. Beyond incredible cocktails. It's quite small and they don't do reservations, so get there early or be prepared to wait--but it's worth it.
For me this is the premier cocktail place in all of St. Louis City.
Cocktails are really great. I didn't have any food.
Awesome food
Best cocktails in STL!
The cocktails I had were alright, though one tasted a bit soapy. Given the premium price, all of our drinks were rather small with some basically being a shot.

I went here the other night with a good friend and we had a perfectly wonderful time. I loved the ambience, the decent service and the fact that they serve a cheese plate and a burger. They had all the things I was looking for.  However, looking back, it's not a place I'm likely to return. The food was fine. Definitely not bad. But only fine. And the prices were kinda high. Higher than they should be for "fine". I consider myself a pretty serious foodie. I put a lot of thought into what recipes I try at home and even more thought into what restaurant is going to give me the best return on my money. And after putting in a lot of time exploring St. Louis over the past year, I can think of quite a few other places that serve cheese plates and burgers that are a lot more interesting than what I experienced here.
Excellent cocktails
Best negroni in town. Best cocktails in town, actually. Wonderful atmosphere, a cozy place to hang out. If you have a bigger group try and snag the couches upstairs - you'll want to stay all night!
yummy setting. nice to be there good food good drinks. go with a few friends and share things
Lovely drink. Exceptional food
Pickle flavored cocktail was SO GOOD! our waiter gave me a list of places to hit in town, and he was exactly what you want in a server. the food was smooth, and well worth the wait to get a seat.
Great cocktails and light food.

Tiny and wonderfully worth the wait!  Get the abduction!  Also loved the chocolate after notes of the drink has no name.  Tasty small plates at a reasonable price.  Our waiter, Brandon, was great.  I'd trust him implicitly.  We tried the duck fat cornbread, fried chicken biscuits, pork belly & mussels are were NOT disappointed.
Wow, what a wonderful date night place. The food is great, and the atmosphere is perfect.
Always a great experience! Food and drinks are awesome!!
This is a good place. Reasonably priced and a good atmosphere.
Our waitress seemed annoyed to be there. Otherwise, the food was astounding, and the bar is as original as they come.
Taste has some of the best cocktails in St. Louis. Excellent small plates as well. Great happy hour special all day Sunday and Monday.

In all fairness is a 3 1/2. However with all the hype this resto got I expected better food. I went their twice to make sure. It's a good atmosphere although the loudness resemble more a bar than a restaurant. I cannot give it 4 or 5 stars because simply put the food was not stellar. Do go and check it for yourself.
Awesome cocktails and a great atmosphere. Perfect date spot for drinks and conversation
One of the best craft cocktail bars in town. Happy Hour with classic cocktails  on Sunday and Monday nights.
Love the craft cocktails!
Excellent drinks.
This is just the best cocktail bar in town. And the food and environment are also great
It's the best chicken I've ever had at a restaurant. Sooooo good. The wine paired with it, though could of been better.
five stars  then there's no disputing their cuisine.

Fantastic service! I took my girlfriend here for her birthday, and they let me make a reservation for two even though they usually only allow that for parties of more than 6. The food was fantastic, and the bar made delicious cocktails through the evening. Also, the bar sent over a complimentary glass of champagne, which was also wonderful of them and completely unexpected! Overall just a great date night place in Central West End.

One of the best bars I've been to. We were seated at the bar, and the bartender introduced us to rhubarb liqueurs when we asked about them. The cocktails were tasteful and unique, and the company great.

Delicious cocktails that you'd expect to find in a big city, but at St. Louis prices. It is certainly an upscale location, but as a date night you can't get much better ambiance and mood with excellent service and creative cocktails/small plates. Keep an eye out for their Sunday happy hour too!

This was the highlight of our trip to St. Louis! This is a small plate (tapas style) bar that specializes in craft cocktails. Every drink and dish we had were delicious. There were 8 of us, and we were seated in the lounge area upstairs. We stayed for about 4 hours, just enjoying round after round of delicious food and drinks. My favorite food dishes were the gnudi and the grilled flank steak. My favorite cocktail was Heavy Water, but instead of vodka, I substituted it for gin per our server's recommendation. Everyone at the table ended up ordering that for their next cocktail after sampling mine. We will definitely come back next time we are in town!
Amazing tapas style restaurant with great drinks.
Amazing drinks, and solid food.  All around good time.
The drinks are spot on. Food is excellent
Amazing cocktails! Tried 5 small plates and there were all delicious! Fun place, great service. Highly recommend the drink, No More Tangles!
This bar is for grown-ups. Great music, great drinks, great mixologists. An all-around great vibe.
Some of the best cocktails I've had in my life
Had the Flank Steak.  It was great, and the portion sizes are small, but appropriate for dinner time.  Will cone again
Wonderful assortment of small plates and a vast selection of cocktails. Happy hour is 5pm-7pm and includes $7 classic cocktails normally priced at $9.
Good cocktails, small plates that change frequently
Unique inspirations on classic drinks! Great and knowledgeable wait staff
Old Fashioned had a fly in it. But it was just a small one. And it still tasted good. But still it was a fly. 3 stars. I guess.
A place that stays open until late!!!
Amazing cocktails, service, and small plates.
Lots of interesting, unique drinks. The food was great as well.

Fantastic cocktail program with very nice small plates. Prepare to spend around $30 or more per person.  Cocktails are classic to modern and beyond, and are consistently good. They are all difficult to make, so they do take some time.  Definitely order the corn bread.
You might go poor while drinking here but it is worth it. The bartenders can make just about anything and will even whip up new drinks on the spot. I hope to one day make enough money to go back :)
Great cocktails. Great food. Their Manhattans are awesome.

Lovely place for a night-time hang. Lots of different sorts of areas to hang out in. The cozy nook upstairs is great for a group of 8 or so. Great, creative food too. I'm a big fan of the broccoli rabe bruschetta. Prices aren't cheap, though.

Taste Bar is the best bar. Logically, the drinks are the focus. The drink menu alone is something like 6-8 pages long, though 90% of the time I do a "bartender's choice" where I give them a few guidelines and let them make something. The food is no joke, though. It's a Gerard Craft restaurant, so that is to be expected.
The best NYE party I have ever attended, hands down. Great food, AMAZING drinks and festive punches, and honestly a super fun group of people.  Please do it again next year!!
Magnificent cocktails and service. Great food too. I have not heard of most of the ingredients (besides major liquors) so had tons a questions for patient staff. Can't wait to go again.

Some of the best house cocktails and drinks in the area, and the bartenders are more than prepared to make you a custom drink to your tastes on the spot. The food menu also offers pretty flavorful and inventive small dishes and entrees. Reservations definitely encouraged for the weekend.
One of my favorite spots in St. Louis!
Friendly staff, good beers
This place is fantastic. Eat all the foods.
organic duck with sauteed kelp and fried honey cornbread  Beautiful!  love it all try the drink,the dark and stormy.
Very good! We had drinks and dessert. They where both perfect! The waitress gave wonderful suggestions. The atmosphere was cozy and warm, perfect for a cold winter night.
Great drinks.
Phenomenal. Every single dish I've tried I've loved. Best fried pickles in Saint Louis. Really can't go wrong here.

I love this place! I discovered it recently on one of my bi-monthly trips to the city with my boyfriend. The location is quaint and hip, and the atmosphere inside is lovely. The light is ambient (but not overly dim) and curtains line the entrance where a hostess will greet you. The first time I went, the wait was 30 minutes and we were offered a seat at the bar. And boy, I'm so glad we accepted! There were 3 bartenders at the bar and Joel served us until our table was ready, offering not only drink suggestions but an extensive knowledge of each of the ingredients in the menu's cocktail. I love interesting, creative cocktails, but I also love knowing exactly which ingredient is being added to my drink... so this was my jam. The experience was so much fun! I admittedly was behooved by many of the foreign names but Joel delivered satisfying explanations (all the while impressively multitasking with multiple cocktail shakers and fruit presses). The drink menu is definitely inspiring, but if I had to recommend one cocktail it would definitely be the Ab-duck-tion. Yes, I'm a relatively adventurous eater anyway, but I think even the old fashioned drinkers would enjoy this one! It's a lovely combination of duckfat infused grand marnier, lavender bitters, absinthe, egg whites, and marscapone. YUM! My new obsession! When we were seated at our table we had a very happy buzz going on, and the food was served pretty quickly. We continued to order cocktails while seated-- we couldn't get enough! And the food was delicious. Altogether a homerun experience. I'm definitely planning all of my upcoming St. Louis trips around a visit to Taste!!
Wonderful Food, Service and Decor

Staff was super friendly and accommodating, cocktails were really delicious and well made, charcuterie plate was a little lacking but the mussels far exceeded expectations. "Classic cocktails" are listed on menu in dates originated instead of pricing, so I was pleasantly surprised when most were $8 instead of 10 or more. I'll be back again soon!

I love Taste.  It's very close to my apartment so I come here a lot.  I love that the establishment is small and intimate.  The bar is always a great place to hang out and grab a few awesome drinks and some small appetizers.  The small plates at Taste make for a good full feeling, instead of overly full.  My favorite drink is the In A Pickle - if you haven't had it, try it - it will blow your mind...

GO HERE !!! -- Do it before it gets too crowded, big, or they change their ways.  The food is outer-wordly but not weird (no worms, brains, snakes, etc) however there are no other ways to describe it as I don't think they adhere to any specific origin or even culinary style.  They have small plates (think "tapas"), you want to order at least 3 of them to share with your date.  They change the menu every other week or so, but if it is still there, order the beet salad... yes I know it is just a beet salad... but it is GOOOOOOOD !  Oh and the drinks are AMAZING, they are some of the most elaborated and refined mixes I've seen anywhere, however, do not order with food, order them after dinner because they are so elaborate and rich they collide with the food -- it was my only critique I had when they came to ask what I thought. Order wine or stick with water first, then DO try the original mixes.  The place is small, dark-ish, with good ambiance and decor. Make sure you have a plan to wait for a table just in case (not sure they take reservations for a company of two).
Nice mixed drinks, great small plates.

One of my favorite spots in the CWE and St. Louis in general. Trades just as much on cocktails as it does on its delicious food. I love coming here with friends and getting a bunch of small plates. Kind of pricey, but very much worth it. Pretty great happy hour from 5-7pm with "classic" cocktails $6 instead of $8 (Tuesday-Friday and all day Sunday-Monday).

They have fantastic drinks, they are really something special. But they have a manager that is a jerk and gives attitude. It is personally reasonable that sometimes they don't have space, but I feel like he talks to me like I'm an idiot so sometimes I don't want to give them my business because of those bad experiences I've had, but the drinks are so delicious.
Outstanding drinks and even better food. Best to come with a group so you can try even more dishes!
Great cocktails, and great food.  Go there, and plan on getting at least two of their cocktails.  Besides the cocktail list, they can make whatever you want, and make it well.
